skill.name: histolab
skill.description: Digital pathology image processing toolkit for whole slide images (WSI). Use this skill when working with histopathology slides, processing H&E or IHC stained tissue images, extracting tiles from gigapixel pathology images, detecting tissue regions, segmenting tissue masks, or preparing datasets for computational pathology deep learning pipelines. Applies to WSI formats (SVS, TIFF, NDPI), tile-based analysis, and histological image preprocessing workflows.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, network calls, or execution behaviors are present in the skill files. Content is documentation and example code for Histolab usage only.

content.user_title: Extract WSI tiles with tissue-aware workflows
content.value_statement: Processing gigapixel pathology slides is slow and error prone. This skill guides Histolab workflows for masking, tiling, and visualization with clear examples.
actual_capabilities: Load WSI slides and inspect dimensions, levels, and metadata
Create tissue masks and preview mask overlays
Extract tiles using random, grid, or score-based strategies
Apply preprocessing filters and filter pipelines
Visualize thumbnails, masks, and tile locations
limitations: Requires local Histolab installation and supported WSI formats
Does not train or evaluate machine learning models
Does not perform clinical interpretation or diagnosis
Examples assume access to slide files on disk

use_cases.title: Sample diverse tiles
use_cases.description: Quickly extract random tiles for exploratory analysis and dataset bootstrapping.

use_cases.title: Build training datasets
use_cases.description: Generate tissue filtered tile datasets with reproducible parameters and reports.

use_cases.title: Review slide quality
use_cases.description: Visualize tissue masks and tile coverage to catch artifacts early.

prompt_templates.title: Preview masks
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a TissueMask, preview it on a slide, and save a thumbnail.

prompt_templates.title: Random tiles
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract 100 random 512x512 tiles at level 0 with tissue filtering and a fixed seed.

prompt_templates.title: Grid coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a GridTiler to cover all tissue with zero overlap and level 1 extraction.

prompt_templates.title: Score selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use ScoreTiler with NucleiScorer and generate a CSV report for the top 50 tiles.

output_examples.input: Extract 50 random tiles and preview locations first
output: Loaded the slide and saved a thumbnail
Previewed 20 tile locations on the thumbnail
Extracted 50 tiles into the output folder

best_practices: Preview masks and tile locations before extraction
Use consistent seeds for reproducible sampling
Adjust tissue_percent based on stain quality
anti_patterns: Extracting tiles without checking tissue coverage
Using level 0 for every workflow without need
Skipping mask customization on artifact heavy slides

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance is plain text and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: It focuses on WSI formats such as SVS, TIFF, and NDPI supported by Histolab.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, examples show Python workflows that you can script and automate.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No, the skill contains only documentation and example code.

faq.question: What if no tiles are extracted?
faq.answer: Lower tissue_percent, verify the mask, and check the slide thumbnail for tissue.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic image tools?
faq.answer: It targets WSI workflows with tilers, tissue masks, and slide metadata handling.
